q: the 2011 Dodge Grand Caravan and Chrysler Town and Country this week. "We need to completely rethink the minivan," CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made. We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile. Sergio Marchionne said that could mean new products that can still carry a lot of people but won't look like traditional minivans. A team within the company is also studying whether to continue both the Town and Country

Eric Schmidt said faster wireless standards such as LTE would greatly improve the web-surfing experience of the next generation of devices. It's interesting that Germany has a leading role in the introduction of the LTE in Europe, he said. A story published Saturday said Daniels would be the odds-on favorite for the GOP nomination in 2012 if pundits, conservative columnists and political thinkers represented the party's base. The diminutive Hoosier has nurtured a profile as a mature politician whose outlook extends beyond the next news cycle and whose demeanor exudes seriousness, the story said. It also noted that the candidate favored by party elites has almost always failed to win the nomination. As for Mike Pence , a story Friday highlighted the effort by a group of conservatives

As for honoring a convicted felon, Dwaine Caraway said, "I care deeply about animals" and "am deeply sorry to offend anyone who loves animals." He acknowledged Michael Vick 's past but noted that since making some bad choices, Michael Vick has devoted time to speaking to children about staying in school staying away from drugs, making positive choices about picking friends and the importance of education. That was the focus of the event. Mayor Tom Leppert said he has asked the city manager to "propose guidelines to prevent this situation in the future. Dwaine Caraway said he would "welcome a clarification of the guidelines."
